name: wwi-start
description: The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand sparked the Great War.

name: wwi-end
description: The armistice was signed ending the Great War after four years of conflict.

name: wwii-start
description: Germany invaded Poland, triggering declarations of war from Britain and France.

name: wwii-end-europe
description: Nazi Germany surrendered unconditionally, ending World War II in Europe.

name: wwii-end-pacific
description: Japan surrendered after atomic bombs were dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki.

name: american-revolution-start
description: The Battles of Lexington and Concord marked the start of American independence.

name: american-independence
description: The thirteen American colonies declared independence from British rule.

name: french-revolution-start
description: The storming of the Bastille ignited revolutionary fervor across France.

name: napoleon-waterloo
description: Napoleon Bonaparte was decisively defeated, ending his rule over France.

name: us-civil-war-start
description: Confederate forces attacked Fort Sumter, starting the bloodiest American conflict.

name: us-civil-war-end
description: General Lee surrendered at Appomattox Courthouse, ending the Civil War.

name: lincoln-assassination
description: President Lincoln was shot by John Wilkes Booth at Ford's Theatre.

name: russian-revolution
description: The Bolsheviks seized power, establishing the world's first communist state.

name: pearl-harbor
description: Japan's surprise attack brought the United States into World War II.

name: d-day
description: Allied forces landed on Normandy beaches in the largest amphibious invasion in history.

name: korean-war-start
description: North Korea invaded South Korea, beginning a major Cold War conflict.

name: korean-war-armistice
description: An armistice halted fighting on the Korean Peninsula, though no peace treaty was signed.

name: vietnam-war-start
description: The United States deployed ground troops to South Vietnam.

name: vietnam-war-end
description: North Vietnamese forces captured Saigon, ending the Vietnam War.

name: berlin-wall-fall
description: East Germany opened its borders, symbolizing the end of the Cold War.

name: soviet-union-collapse
description: The USSR officially dissolved into fifteen independent republics.

name: gulf-war
description: A US-led coalition launched Operation Desert Storm to liberate Kuwait.

name: september-11
description: Terrorists hijacked planes and attacked the World Trade Center and Pentagon.

name: iraq-war-start
description: The United States invaded Iraq to overthrow Saddam Hussein's regime.

name: magna-carta
description: English barons forced King John to sign a charter limiting royal power.

name: hundred-years-war-start
description: England and France began a prolonged conflict over succession and territory.

name: hundred-years-war-end
description: France expelled the English, ending over a century of intermittent warfare.

name: constantinople-fall
description: Ottoman forces conquered the Byzantine capital, ending the Eastern Roman Empire.

name: spanish-armada
description: England repelled Spain's massive invasion fleet, securing Protestant rule.

name: english-civil-war-start
description: Conflict erupted between Parliamentarians and Royalists over governance of England.

name: charles-i-execution
description: The English king was beheaded after being convicted of treason.

name: glorious-revolution
description: William of Orange overthrew King James II in a largely bloodless coup.

name: seven-years-war-start
description: A global conflict erupted involving most European great powers.

name: bastille-day
description: Parisian revolutionaries stormed the royal fortress, symbolizing the revolution.

name: louis-xvi-execution
description: The French king was guillotined during the Reign of Terror.

name: haitian-revolution
description: Haiti became the first nation founded by a successful slave revolt.

name: napoleon-emperor
description: Napoleon Bonaparte crowned himself Emperor of the French.

name: war-1812
description: The United States declared war on Britain over trade restrictions and impressment.

name: napoleon-russia
description: Napoleon's Grande Arm√©e invaded Russia in a disastrous campaign.

name: greek-independence
description: Greeks revolted against Ottoman rule, seeking national independence.

name: mexican-american-war
description: Conflict erupted between the US and Mexico over Texas annexation.

name: revolutions-1848
description: A wave of revolutionary uprisings swept across Europe demanding reform.

name: crimean-war
description: Britain, France, and the Ottoman Empire fought against Russian expansion.

name: indian-rebellion
description: Indian soldiers revolted against the British East India Company.

name: italian-unification
description: The Kingdom of Italy unified the Italian peninsula under one government.

name: german-unification
description: Prussia united German states into the German Empire after defeating France.

name: franco-prussian-war
description: Prussia and German allies went to war with France over succession disputes.

name: paris-commune
description: Radical socialists briefly governed Paris before being violently suppressed.

name: spanish-american-war
description: The US defeated Spain, gaining control of Cuba, Puerto Rico, and the Philippines.

name: boer-war
description: Britain fought Dutch settlers in South Africa in a brutal colonial conflict.

name: russo-japanese-war
description: Japan defeated Russia, becoming the first Asian power to beat a European nation.

name: russian-revolution-1905
description: Mass unrest forced Tsar Nicholas II to create a parliament.

name: chinese-revolution
description: Revolutionaries overthrew the Qing Dynasty, establishing the Republic of China.

name: lusitania-sinking
description: A German U-boat sank the British liner, killing 1,198 including 128 Americans.

name: battle-somme
description: One of the bloodiest battles in history killed over one million soldiers.

name: treaty-versailles
description: The peace treaty officially ended World War I and imposed harsh terms on Germany.

name: irish-independence
description: Irish republicans launched a guerrilla war against British rule.

name: mussolini-power
description: The March on Rome brought Benito Mussolini to power as Italy's fascist leader.

name: hitler-chancellor
description: Adolf Hitler was appointed Chancellor of Germany, beginning Nazi rule.

name: spanish-civil-war
description: Nationalist forces led by Franco rebelled against Spain's Republican government.

name: kristallnacht
description: Nazi mobs attacked Jewish businesses and synagogues across Germany.

name: munich-agreement
description: European powers allowed Hitler to annex part of Czechoslovakia.

name: battle-britain
description: The Royal Air Force defended Britain against sustained German bombing.

name: stalingrad
description: Soviet forces defeated Germany in a turning point of World War II.

name: nuremberg-trials
description: Nazi war criminals were prosecuted for crimes against humanity.

name: indian-independence
description: India gained independence from British rule and was partitioned with Pakistan.

name: israel-founded
description: Israel declared independence, immediately sparking conflict with Arab neighbors.

name: nato-founded
description: Western nations formed a military alliance against Soviet expansion.

name: chinese-communist-victory
description: Mao Zedong's communists defeated the Nationalists and founded the People's Republic.

name: cuban-revolution
description: Fidel Castro's forces overthrew the Batista dictatorship in Cuba.

name: bay-of-pigs
description: A CIA-backed invasion of Cuba by exiles failed disastrously.

name: cuban-missile-crisis
description: The US and USSR came to the brink of nuclear war over missiles in Cuba.

name: jfk-assassination
description: President John F. Kennedy was shot and killed in Dallas, Texas.

name: six-day-war
description: Israel defeated Arab nations and captured the Sinai, Gaza, West Bank, and Golan Heights.

name: mlk-assassination
description: The civil rights leader was shot in Memphis, sparking nationwide unrest.

name: prague-spring
description: Soviet forces invaded Czechoslovakia to end political liberalization.

name: yom-kippur-war
description: Egypt and Syria launched a surprise attack on Israel during the Jewish holiday.

name: watergate
description: President Nixon resigned facing impeachment for the Watergate scandal.

name: cambodian-genocide
description: The Khmer Rouge seized Cambodia and began a genocide killing nearly two million.

name: iranian-revolution
description: Islamic revolutionaries overthrew the Shah and established a theocratic republic.

name: soviet-afghanistan
description: The Soviet Union invaded Afghanistan to support its communist government.

name: falklands-war
description: Britain and Argentina fought over the Falkland Islands in the South Atlantic.

name: tiananmen-square
description: Chinese troops killed pro-democracy protesters in Beijing.

name: german-reunification
description: East and West Germany reunited as a single nation after 45 years.

name: yugoslavia-wars-start
description: Yugoslavia began to dissolve amid ethnic conflicts and declarations of independence.

name: apartheid-ends
description: South Africa held its first democratic elections, ending racial segregation.

name: rwandan-genocide
description: Hutu extremists killed approximately 800,000 Tutsis and moderate Hutus.

name: oklahoma-city-bombing
description: A domestic terrorist attack killed 168 people at a federal building.

name: srebrenica-massacre
description: Bosnian Serb forces killed over 8,000 Bosniak Muslims in Europe's worst post-WWII atrocity.

name: good-friday-agreement
description: A peace agreement largely ended decades of conflict in Northern Ireland.

name: kosovo-war
description: NATO bombing forced Serbian withdrawal from Kosovo.

name: afghanistan-war-start
description: The US invaded Afghanistan following the September 11 attacks.

name: saddam-hussein-captured
description: US forces captured the Iraqi dictator hiding in a spider hole.

name: madrid-bombings
description: Terrorist attacks on commuter trains killed 193 people in Spain.

name: london-bombings
description: Suicide bombers attacked London's transport system, killing 52 people.

name: bin-laden-killed
description: US Navy SEALs killed the al-Qaeda leader in Pakistan.

name: arab-spring
description: Pro-democracy protests swept across the Middle East and North Africa.

name: syrian-civil-war
description: Anti-government protests in Syria escalated into a devastating civil war.

name: crimea-annexation
description: Russia seized and annexed the Crimean Peninsula from Ukraine.

name: isis-caliphate
description: The Islamic State declared a caliphate across parts of Iraq and Syria.

name: brexit-vote
description: The United Kingdom voted to leave the European Union.

name: russia-ukraine-invasion
description: Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine, starting a major European war.
